metadata.purpose: Structured knowledge base for voice agent support system

intents.what_is: User asking about what something is or how it works
intents.how_to: User asking for instructions on how to do something
intents.problem: User reporting a problem or technical issue
intents.pricing: User asking about cost or payment
intents.content: User asking about learning content or topics

questions.question: What is LearnFlow?
questions.answer: LearnFlow is an AI-powered learning platform that creates personalized learning journeys on any topic you choose. Unlike traditional courses, we generate custom, structured lessons instantly tailored to exactly what you want to learn. You can learn in multiple formats—text, audio, slides, interactive chat with a tutor, or visual diagrams. It's completely self-paced with no deadlines.

questions.question: How do I sign up?
questions.answer: Visit the homepage and click 'Start Your Journey' or 'Sign Up'. You can either create an account with your email address and a password, or if you're an EDNA member, use our single sign-on feature. It takes just a minute.
follow_up: Do I need an account to browse?

questions.question: Is LearnFlow free?
questions.answer: Yes! LearnFlow is completely free. You can create unlimited learning paths, use all learning formats (text, audio, slides, chat tutoring, and visual diagrams), and explore the entire community section at no cost. There are no hidden fees or premium plans.
follow_up: What if I want more features?

questions.question: Can I use LearnFlow on my phone?
questions.answer: Absolutely! LearnFlow is fully mobile-responsive, so you can access it on your smartphone, tablet, or desktop. You can learn anywhere, anytime.

questions.question: Is my learning data private?
questions.answer: Yes. Your learning projects and progress are private to your account by default. You can choose to publish learning paths publicly to share with the community, but your private projects remain just for you. Your data is encrypted in transit and at rest on our secure servers.
follow_up: How do I make a path public?

questions.question: How do I create a new learning path?
questions.answer: Once you're logged in, click the 'Start Your Journey' button or the floating '+' button. A dialog will open asking you to enter the topic you want to learn. Type your topic (for example: 'Python basics for beginners' or 'How to start a vegetable garden'), and our AI will generate a structured 10-step learning plan within 10-30 seconds. You'll review the plan and approve it, then the lesson content starts generating automatically.

questions.question: How many steps are in a learning path?
questions.answer: Every learning path has 10 steps, each building progressively on the last. This gives you a complete journey from foundational concepts to more advanced understanding. Each step takes about 10-15 minutes to complete, though you can go at your own pace.
follow_up: How long does it take to complete?

questions.question: How long does it take to generate a learning path?
questions.answer: The learning plan itself (the 10 step titles and outlines) generates in about 10-30 seconds. Then the detailed content for each step generates in the background—usually completed within a few minutes. You can start learning immediately while content is still generating.
follow_up: Can I use it while generating?

questions.question: What can LearnFlow teach me?
questions.answer: LearnFlow can create learning paths on virtually any topic. Whether you want to learn Python programming, understand the history of jazz, master public speaking, explore machine learning, learn gardening, or understand quantum physics—just type it in and we'll create a structured learning path for you.

questions.question: What makes each learning path unique?
questions.answer: Every time you create a path—even on the same topic—the AI generates completely fresh content based on exactly how you phrase your topic request. So 'Python for beginners' will generate different content than 'Learning Python from scratch.' This personalization ensures each path matches your specific interest.

questions.question: What formats can I learn in?
questions.answer: You have five learning formats to choose from: 1) Text - Read lesson content with formatting and code blocks, 2) Audio - Listen to an AI-narrated version with multiple voice options, 3) Slides - View content as visual presentations, 4) Chat Tutor - Have an interactive conversation with an AI tutor, 5) Visual Diagrams - See generated mental model images. You can switch between formats anytime.

questions.question: Can I listen to the content?
questions.answer: Yes! Switch to Audio mode and listen to an AI-narrated version of the lesson. The narrator reads through the entire lesson, and you can follow along at your own pace. We offer multiple voice options including Nova, Alloy, Echo, Fable, Onyx, and Shimmer.

questions.question: Can I change the voice?
questions.answer: We offer multiple voice options including Nova, Alloy, Echo, Fable, Onyx, and Shimmer. You can select your preferred voice in the Audio player settings. Different voices have different tones and accents, so try a few to find what you like.

questions.question: Can I adjust the speed of the audio?
questions.answer: Yes, you can adjust playback speed in the audio player. Common speeds are 1x (normal), 1.25x, 1.5x, and 2x speed for faster learning.
follow_up: What speed do most people use?

questions.question: What is the Chat Tutor?
questions.answer: The Chat Tutor is an AI-powered interactive learning assistant. You can ask questions about the material you're learning, request clarification, ask for examples, or explore related concepts. The Tutor responds based on the specific content of your learning path.

questions.question: What are Visual Diagrams?
questions.answer: Visual Diagrams are AI-generated images that explain key concepts from your learning path visually. Each 10-step path includes 8 diagrams that break down complex ideas into visual explanations. These are especially helpful if you're a visual learner.

questions.question: What are Deep Dive topics?
questions.answer: As you're learning, you might encounter concepts that you want to understand more deeply. Deep Dive topics let you explore related concepts in more detail while staying in context. For example, if you're learning about Python and encounter decorators, you can deep dive into that specific topic for a more thorough explanation.
follow_up: How do I use deep dives?

questions.question: What are Related Topics?
questions.answer: After completing a learning path, the Related Topics section suggests other connected topics you might want to explore next. For instance, after learning Python basics, you might see suggestions for 'Object-Oriented Programming in Python' or 'Web Development with Python.'

questions.question: What are Practice Questions?
questions.answer: AI generates comprehension questions based on the actual content you've learned in each step. These help you test your understanding and reinforce key concepts. You can use them as a quick self-check or study tool.

questions.question: Can I save my progress and come back later?
questions.answer: Absolutely! Your progress is automatically saved. You can see all your active learning projects on your Projects page with completion percentages shown. Click 'Continue Learning' to pick up right where you left off.
follow_up: What if I delete a project?

questions.question: How long does it take to complete a learning path?
questions.answer: Most learning paths take 2-4 hours to complete if you go straight through. However, since LearnFlow is completely self-paced, you can take as long as you want. Many users spread learning across multiple days or weeks, returning whenever they have time.

questions.question: Can I take notes while learning?
questions.answer: Yes! You can save Margin Notes on specific passages or concepts while reading. These notes are saved to your account and help you remember key insights and important points.
follow_up: How do I view saved notes?

questions.question: Can I skip steps or learn out of order?
questions.answer: While steps are designed to build progressively, you can navigate between steps. However, we recommend going through them in order since each step builds on concepts from previous ones.
follow_up: What if I already know step 1?
Can I jump to the end?

questions.question: Do all learning formats show the same content?
questions.answer: The core content is the same across text, audio, and slides—just presented differently. The Chat Tutor feature provides interactive Q&A based on the material, and Visual Diagrams provide visual explanations of key concepts. All formats are built from the same AI-generated lesson plan.

questions.question: What is the Community section?
questions.answer: The Community section shows public learning paths created by LearnFlow users. You can browse, search, like, and fork (copy as your own) learning paths created by others. It's a way to discover what topics other learners are interested in and benefit from their learning journeys.
follow_up: How do I publish my path?

questions.question: Can I publish my learning path publicly?
questions.answer: Yes! Once you've created and approved your learning path, you can choose to make it public. Other users will then be able to find it, view it, like it, and fork it to their own accounts.
follow_up: Can I make it private again?

questions.question: What does 'liking' a path do?
questions.answer: Liking a path indicates you found it useful or interesting. It helps the path gain visibility in the Community section and encourages the creator.

questions.question: What does 'forking' a path do?
questions.answer: Forking creates your own personal copy of someone else's learning path. This is useful if you want to use their topic structure but customize it for your own learning. The original creator is credited.
follow_up: Can I edit a forked path?
Will they know I forked it?

questions.question: How are community paths ranked or sorted?
questions.answer: Community paths can be sorted by Recent (newest first), Popular (most liked), Views (most viewed), Featured (staff picks), or Trending (gaining attention). You can choose your preferred sorting method when browsing.

questions.question: Can I see who created a learning path?
questions.answer: Yes, each public path shows the creator's profile. You can click to view their profile and see other paths they've created.

questions.question: My content is still loading. How long should I wait?
questions.answer: Content generation typically takes a few minutes. The lesson plan generates first, then the detailed content for each step generates in the background. If you've waited more than 10 minutes and it's still not loading, try refreshing the page.

questions.question: I'm getting an error message. What does it mean?
questions.answer: Error messages vary, but common ones include: 'Generation timeout' (AI took too long—try again), 'Invalid topic' (be more specific), 'Network error' (check connection), 'Something went wrong' (refresh and retry). If you're consistently getting errors, contact support.

questions.question: The page won't load. What should I do?
questions.answer: Try these steps: 1) Check your internet connection, 2) Refresh the page (Ctrl+R or Command+R), 3) Try a different browser, 4) Clear your browser cache, 5) Try again in a few minutes. If it still won't work after these steps, contact support.

questions.question: The audio is glitching or cutting out. How do I fix it?
questions.answer: Try these steps: 1) Refresh the page, 2) Close other browser tabs to free up bandwidth, 3) Try a different voice option, 4) Check your internet connection stability, 5) Try the text format instead. If the issue persists, contact support.
follow_up: Will it work if I wait?
Should I try a different device?

questions.question: My progress didn't save. What happened?
questions.answer: Progress auto-saves as you complete steps. If you lost progress: 1) Check that you were logged in, 2) Go to your Projects page to verify your path is there, 3) Refresh the page, 4) Check your browser's local storage isn't disabled. If still missing, contact support.

questions.question: I'm logged out unexpectedly. Why?
questions.answer: A few reasons this might happen: Your session expired after extended inactivity, you cleared your browser cookies, you logged out from another device, there was a network interruption, or a browser extension is clearing your data. Just log back in—your projects and progress are still saved.

questions.question: I generated a learning path but don't like it. Can I regenerate?
questions.answer: Currently, you can delete the path and create a new one with slightly different wording. For example, if 'Python Programming' didn't suit you, try 'Learn Python from Scratch' or 'Python for Beginners.' This often results in different content structure and focus.

questions.question: Some of my content didn't generate properly. What do I do?
questions.answer: This is rare, but if content is missing or broken: 1) Try refreshing the page, 2) Switch to a different format (audio, slides, text), 3) Use the Chat Tutor to get clarification, 4) Delete and recreate the path, 5) Contact support if it continues.

questions.question: The Chat Tutor isn't responding or is giving bad answers. What do I do?
questions.answer: Try these steps: 1) Rephrase your question more clearly, 2) Refresh the page, 3) Ask a different question to see if specific to this query, 4) Try other learning formats, 5) Contact support if the tutor consistently gives poor responses.

questions.question: Visual diagrams aren't loading or look incorrect. How do I fix this?
questions.answer: Try these steps: 1) Refresh the page, 2) Try viewing on a different device, 3) Try a different browser, 4) Check your internet connection, 5) Diagrams can take a few minutes to generate—check back later. If the issue persists, contact support.

questions.question: How do I change my password?
questions.answer: Go to your Account Settings (usually found in the profile menu) and look for the 'Change Password' or 'Security' section. You'll need to verify your current password before setting a new one.

questions.question: How do I delete my account?
questions.answer: Go to Account Settings and look for 'Delete Account' or 'Danger Zone.' Be aware this is permanent and you'll lose all your learning projects and data.

questions.question: Can I change my display name or profile information?
questions.answer: Yes, go to your Profile Settings to update your name, photo, bio, or other profile information.

questions.question: How do I enable dark mode?
questions.answer: Look in Settings for Display or Theme options. You can usually choose between light, dark, or system-based themes.

questions.question: Can I change the language of the platform?
questions.answer: Currently LearnFlow is available in English. We're exploring other languages for future releases.
follow_up: When will other languages be available?

questions.question: What is a Learning Streak?
questions.answer: A Learning Streak tracks consecutive days you've engaged with LearnFlow. Your streak increases by 1 for each day you log in or complete a learning step. It's a motivational feature to encourage consistent learning habits.

questions.question: What is Learning DNA?
questions.answer: Learning DNA analyzes your learning patterns—how you learn best, which formats you prefer, how long you typically study, and your learning goals. This information helps LearnFlow personalize recommendations and suggest new topics that match your interests and style.

questions.question: What are Prompt Insights?
questions.answer: As you create learning paths, Prompt Insights analyzes the wording you use to understand your learning interests and preferences. This helps the system recommend topics you might enjoy learning next.
follow_up: What do I learn about myself?

questions.question: What is Skill Gaps Analysis?
questions.answer: Skill Gaps Analysis looks at the topics you've learned and identifies related skills or knowledge areas that might complement your learning. For example, if you've learned Python, it might suggest 'Database Design' as a complementary skill.

questions.question: What are Predictive Recommendations?
questions.answer: Based on your learning history and profiles of similar learners, the system suggests topics you're likely to find interesting and valuable next.

questions.question: Can I learn offline?
questions.answer: Currently LearnFlow requires an internet connection to display content, generate lessons, and save progress. We're exploring offline capabilities for future versions.

questions.question: What if I don't understand something?
questions.answer: You have several options: 1) Use Chat Tutor to ask questions, 2) Create a Deep Dive for deeper explanation, 3) Look at Visual Diagrams to see concepts visually, 4) Re-read in a different format (try audio if you read text, or slides if you tried audio), 5) Save a Margin Note with your question and revisit later.

questions.question: How accurate is the AI-generated content?
questions.answer: Our AI content generation uses advanced language models to create accurate, well-structured educational content. However, like any educational resource, we recommend: 1) Cross-checking important facts with other sources, 2) Asking the Chat Tutor to clarify or verify information, 3) Using this as supplementary alongside other materials, 4) Reporting significant inaccuracies to support.
follow_up: What if I find an error?

questions.question: Can I share a learning path with someone?
questions.answer: If it's a public path, you can share the link. If it's private, you can either: 1) Publish it and share the public link, 2) Ask the other person to fork your path if you make it public, 3) Contact support about potential sharing features.
follow_up: How do I get the link?
What's the difference between public and private?

questions.question: Can I collaborate on a learning path with others?
questions.answer: Currently, learning paths are individual. You can fork someone else's path to create your own version, but real-time collaboration isn't available yet.
follow_up: What if I want to teach others?

questions.question: Can I use SSO to log in?
questions.answer: Yes, if you're an EDNA member, you can use single sign-on (SSO) to log in. This provides a seamless experience if you already have an EDNA account.

questions.question: I signed up with EDNA SSO but I'm not seeing my profile information.
questions.answer: First-time SSO users get a default profile. Go to Settings to add your profile photo and bio. Your LearnFlow account is separate from your EDNA profile, so you'll need to fill in your information independently.

questions.question: I created the same learning path twice by accident. Can I delete one?
questions.answer: Yes, go to your Projects page, find the duplicate, and click the delete button. This is permanent, so make sure you don't want it before confirming.
follow_up: How do I delete a path?

questions.question: A community path is offensive or inappropriate. How do I report it?
questions.answer: Look for a 'Report' button on the path details. Provide details about why you're reporting it. Our moderation team will review and take action if needed.

questions.question: I found an error or typo in a learning path I created. Can I edit it?
questions.answer: Currently, you can't edit generated content directly. You can: 1) Delete the path and recreate it with adjusted wording, 2) Use Margin Notes to correct information for your reference, 3) Contact support if it's a significant issue.

questions.question: Can I restart a learning path I've already completed?
questions.answer: Yes, you can delete the project and create a new one on the same topic, or contact support about resetting progress on the existing path.

questions.question: I'm seeing sponsored or promoted content. Is that free?
questions.answer: All featured and trending paths in the Community section are user-created content from our community—not sponsored. LearnFlow itself is completely free with no hidden costs or premium tiers.

questions.question: I have a question not covered here. How do I contact support?
questions.answer: You can reach support through: In-app help button or chat (if available), Email support form on the LearnFlow website, Community forums (if available), or Social media channels. When contacting support, include: What you were trying to do, What happened (error message), Your browser and device type, Steps to reproduce the issue.

questions.question: I'd like to suggest a feature. How do I do that?
questions.answer: We love feedback! You can: Use the in-app feedback button, Email feature requests to support, Participate in community discussions, or Check our roadmap to see planned features.

questions.question: Is there a community forum where I can connect with other learners?
questions.answer: While LearnFlow primarily focuses on individual learning, the Community section lets you see what others are learning and fork their paths. You can also like and comment on public paths if those features are available.

questions.question: How does LearnFlow personalize to me?
questions.answer: LearnFlow learns from your behavior—what topics you choose, which formats you prefer, and how long you study. The more you use it, the better it gets to know your learning style. Features like Learning DNA, Prompt Insights, and Predictive Recommendations all work together to create a personalized experience.

questions.question: Do I need to create an account to browse?
questions.answer: You can browse and view public learning paths created by our community without an account. However, to create your own personalized learning journey, you'll need a free account.
follow_up: What can I see without an account?

questions.question: Which learning format is best?
questions.answer: It depends on your preferences! Try them all to see what works for you: Text is good for detailed information and reference, Audio is great for commutes or when multitasking, Slides are useful for visual learners and quick reference, Chat Tutor is perfect for asking questions and clarification, Diagrams are excellent for understanding complex concepts visually.

questions.question: Can I download or export what I've learned?
questions.answer: Currently, your learning is stored in your account for reference. You can take screenshots, use your browser's print function, or copy text. We're exploring export options for future updates.

questions.question: How do I discover learning paths in the Community?
questions.answer: Visit the Community section and use the search bar to find topics of interest. You can also browse by category, sort by recent/popular/trending, or check out featured paths. Liking and exploring different creators helps personalize what you see.

questions.question: I'm new to LearnFlow. Where should I start?
questions.answer: Welcome! Here's how to get started: 1) Sign up for a free account, 2) Click 'Start Your Journey' to create your first learning path, 3) Enter a topic you're curious about, 4) Approve the generated plan, 5) Start learning! Try different formats to see what you prefer. You can always refer back to this knowledge base if you have questions.
follow_up: Which format should I try first?

questions.question: What is the audio summary feature?
questions.answer: After completing or partway through a learning path, you can generate an audio summary—an AI-narrated overview of your entire learning journey. This is great for quick reviews or reinforcing key concepts.

questions.question: Who can see my learning progress?
questions.answer: Your learning progress is private to your account. No one else can see it unless you specifically publish a learning path publicly. Publishing a path shows the path itself and who completed it, but not your personal notes or progress details.

questions.question: What do I do if a generated path doesn't match what I expected?
questions.answer: You have a few options: 1) Use Deep Dives to explore areas in more detail, 2) Try Chat Tutor to ask for alternative perspectives, 3) Complete it anyway to see if later steps improve, 4) Delete and recreate with different wording or more specific instructions. Many users find that being more specific with their topic request helps.
follow_up: How detailed should my request be?

questions.question: How many voice options are available for audio?
questions.answer: We offer six different voice options: Nova, Alloy, Echo, Fable, Onyx, and Shimmer. Each has a different tone, accent, and personality. I recommend trying a few to find which one you enjoy listening to most.

questions.question: What happens after I complete a learning path?
questions.answer: After completing a path, you can: View and listen to an audio summary, Explore Related Topics to expand your knowledge, Share or publish the path publicly, Start a new learning path on a different topic, or Take practice questions to reinforce your learning.
follow_up: What if I want more on this topic?

questions.question: Can I switch between learning formats?
questions.answer: Absolutely! You can switch formats at any time while learning. Go to the format selector (usually at the top of the content area) and choose your preferred format. Your progress stays the same—you'll be at the same step regardless of format.

questions.question: How does LearnFlow determine what's trending in the community?
questions.answer: Trending paths are determined by recent engagement—likes, views, and discussion within the community. Paths that are gaining attention quickly appear in the Trending section. This helps discover fresh content and emerging learning interests.

questions.question: I forgot my password. How do I reset it?
questions.answer: On the login page, look for a 'Forgot Password?' or 'Reset Password' link. Click it and enter your email address. You'll receive an email with instructions to reset your password. Follow the link and create a new password.
follow_up: How long is the reset link valid?

questions.question: Should I be very specific or general when requesting a topic?
questions.answer: Being specific helps! More specific requests like 'Python for Web Development' or 'Beginner Python for Data Analysis' typically produce more focused, relevant content than just 'Python'. You can also add context like 'for beginners' or 'practical applications' to guide the content generation.

questions.question: LearnFlow is running slowly. What can I help?
questions.answer: Try these optimization steps: 1) Close unnecessary browser tabs, 2) Check your internet connection speed, 3) Clear your browser cache, 4) Try a different browser, 5) Refresh the page, 6) Try again at a different time. If it's consistently slow, contact support.

questions.question: How long does each step take?
questions.answer: Each step typically takes about 10-15 minutes to complete, depending on the complexity of the topic and how deeply you want to explore it. However, since learning is self-paced, you can spend as long or as little time on each step as you want.
follow_up: Can I do multiple steps per session?

questions.question: What are featured paths in the Community?
questions.answer: Featured paths are hand-selected by the LearnFlow team based on quality, clarity, and educational value. These represent some of the best learning paths created by our community and are a great place to start exploring.

questions.question: Are there badges or achievements for learning milestones?
questions.answer: LearnFlow tracks learning streaks and progress, which serve as personal motivators. While specific badge systems may vary by version, your learning journey and completed paths are recorded and contribute to your learning profile.

questions.question: Can I adjust the text size or font for better readability?
questions.answer: Most browsers allow you to zoom in and out (Ctrl/Cmd + + or -) to adjust the text size. You can also check Settings for any display or accessibility options LearnFlow offers for text sizing or font preferences.
follow_up: Does zoom work on all devices?

questions.question: If I create multiple paths on the same topic, will they be different?
questions.answer: Yes! Each time you create a path—even on the same topic—the AI generates completely fresh content. The content will differ based on your wording and phrasing. This is part of LearnFlow's personalization approach.
follow_up: What if I want the same content?

questions.question: Can I turn off notifications or emails?
questions.answer: Check your Settings or Account Preferences for notification and email options. You should be able to customize which emails you receive and how often.

questions.question: What are slides like as a learning format?
questions.answer: Slides present the lesson content in a visual presentation format with key points highlighted. This format works well if you prefer visual learning or want a quick overview of the material. You can navigate forward and backward through slides at your own pace.

account_onboarding.description: Questions about signing up, account creation, basic features

features.description: Questions about what features LearnFlow offers

learning_paths.description: Questions about creating and using learning paths

learning_formats.description: Questions about different ways to learn (text, audio, etc)

community.description: Questions about community features, sharing, public paths

troubleshooting.description: Technical issues and problems users encounter

escalation_triggers.description: User reports losing data or projects
User cannot access account or locked out
User reports security issues or suspicious activity
User wants to delete account permanently
User has privacy or data protection questions
User requests new feature or significant changes
escalation_triggers.action: Log and route to product team

escalation_triggers.description: User disputes accuracy of generated content

voice_agent_tips.greeting: Welcome to LearnFlow support! I'm here to help you learn better.
voice_agent_tips.pace: Slow down for complex explanations, speak clearly
voice_agent_tips.personalization: Use the user's name if available, reference their history if known
common_openings: How can I help you with LearnFlow?
Do you have questions about learning paths?
Are you experiencing a technical issue?
common_closings: Is there anything else I can help with?
Feel free to reach out if you have more questions
We're here if you need us
voice_agent_tips.when_unsure: Let me look that up for you
That's a great question—let me find the best answer
key_principles: Always assume the user is smart but new to this
Avoid jargon, explain technical terms simply
Offer to escalate if the issue is beyond support
Encourage exploration and trying different formats
